page.title: 04ST.JOHNS CHAPEL MART (1)
page.content:
Our class visited the mart at the end of April and it was quite busy. The mart is near the village green, and this was covered with parked cars, landrovers and cattle wagons. There were also lots of vehicles parked on the grass verge along the main road leading to Daddry Shield.
The mart is a large building made of corrugated steel and wood. It is surrounded on the outside by pens for the cattle and sheep to stand in before they are sold. At the back of the mart building is a small office where the farmers pay for the stock that they have bought.
All the cows and sheep had numbers stuck on their backs so that the auctioneer knows who they belong to.
